items.headline: Pacers Lock Up Breakout Guard Quenton Jackson with Three-Year Deal
items.summary: The Indiana Pacers have reportedly rewarded two-way guard Quenton Jackson with an impressive new three-year standard contract, signaling a promotion after his strong performance.

items.headline: Mavericks Waive Tyus Jones, Set to Promote Ryan Nembhard
items.summary: The Dallas Mavericks are waiving veteran guard Tyus Jones before Sunday's roster deadline, making way for two-way guard Ryan Nembhard to sign a full NBA contract as he approaches his active game limit.

items.headline: Cavaliers Hit with Injury Woes: Harden Out with Fractured Thumb, Mitchell Also Sidelined
items.summary: Cleveland Cavaliers guard James Harden is sidelined with a fractured right thumb, an injury sustained earlier this week. The team is also without Donovan Mitchell, who is recovering from a strained groin.

items.headline: Israeli All-Star Deni Avdija Doubtful for Blazers-Hornets Matchup with Back Injury
items.summary: Portland Trail Blazers forward Deni Avdija, an NBA All-Star Reserve, is listed as doubtful for today's game against the Charlotte Hornets due to a lingering lower back injury. Avdija has been battling the issue for weeks and had to exit a recent game early.

items.headline: Celtics Dominate Nets with Historic Shooting Display
items.summary: The Boston Celtics put on an offensive clinic, shooting a season-high 66.7% from the field in a dominant victory over the Brooklyn Nets.

items.headline: SGA's Return Fuels Thunder OT Win Over Nuggets
items.summary: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander returned from a nine-game absence with 36 points, leading the Oklahoma City Thunder to a gritty overtime win against the Denver Nuggets in a heated contest.

items.headline: Pistons Edge Cavaliers in Overtime Thriller
items.summary: The Detroit Pistons secured an overtime victory against the Cleveland Cavaliers, with Jalen Duren delivering a monstrous performance.

items.headline: Knicks Rout Bucks Behind Brunson and Anunoby
items.summary: The New York Knicks cruised past the Milwaukee Bucks with strong performances from Jalen Brunson and OG Anunoby.

items.headline: Hornets Take Down Pacers; Knueppel Makes Rookie History
items.summary: The Charlotte Hornets defeated the Indiana Pacers, highlighted by rookie Kon Knueppel breaking the NBA's all-time rookie record for most three-pointers made in a season.

items.headline: 76ers Hold Off Heat in Clutch Battle
items.summary: The Philadelphia 76ers extended their winning streak, fending off the Miami Heat in a close contest.

items.headline: Durant's 40-Point Outburst Leads Rockets Past Magic
items.summary: Kevin Durant's 40 points powered the Houston Rockets to a victory over the Orlando Magic.

items.headline: Hawks Cruise Past Wizards
items.summary: The Atlanta Hawks secured a comfortable win against the Washington Wizards, extending their winning streak.

items.headline: Trail Blazers Defeat Bulls
items.summary: The Portland Trail Blazers ended the Chicago Bulls' winning streak with a solid performance.

items.headline: Kings Outduel Mavericks
items.summary: The Sacramento Kings beat the Dallas Mavericks in a high-scoring affair.

items.headline: Suns Stun Lakers with Late Game-Winner
items.summary: The Phoenix Suns snapped their losing streak, defeating the Los Angeles Lakers thanks to a game-winning three-pointer from Royce O'Neale.

items.headline: Timberwolves Hold Off Clippers
items.summary: The Minnesota Timberwolves secured their second consecutive win by overcoming the LA Clippers.

items.headline: Pelicans Down Jazz with Bey's Explosive Scoring
items.summary: Saddiq Bey led the New Orleans Pelicans to victory over the Utah Jazz with an outstanding scoring effort.

items.headline: Trail Blazers vs. Hornets
items.summary: The Portland Trail Blazers visit the Charlotte Hornets. Deni Avdija (POR) is doubtful for this contest.

items.headline: Rockets vs. Heat
items.summary: The Houston Rockets take on the Miami Heat.

items.headline: Raptors vs. Wizards
items.summary: The Toronto Raptors face off against the Washington Wizards.

items.headline: Lakers vs. Warriors
items.summary: A Western Conference showdown sees the Los Angeles Lakers visit the Golden State Warriors. The Lakers will aim to snap a three-game losing streak.

items.headline: Pelicans vs. Jazz
items.summary: The New Orleans Pelicans clash with the Utah Jazz.

items.headline: SGA Shines in Return with 36 Points
items.summary: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander dominated with 36 points, 9 assists, and 3 rebounds in his return from a nine-game abdominal strain, leading the OKC Thunder to an overtime victory. He is now just 4 games away from tying Wilt Chamberlain's record for consecutive 20-point games.

items.headline: Saddiq Bey Explodes for 42 Points
items.summary: New Orleans Pelicans forward Saddiq Bey delivered an explosive offensive performance, pouring in 42 points against the Utah Jazz.

items.headline: Kevin Durant Drops 40 Points for Rockets
items.summary: Kevin Durant put on a scoring clinic for the Houston Rockets, tallying an impressive 40 points in their win over the Orlando Magic.

items.headline: Jalen Duren's Double-Double Dominance
items.summary: Detroit Pistons center Jalen Duren recorded a massive 33 points and 16 rebounds, along with 3 assists and 3 blocks, making him the youngest player since Luka Dončić to have four consecutive games with 25+ points and 10+ rebounds.

items.headline: Nikola Jokić Logs Another Triple-Double
items.summary: Denver Nuggets superstar Nikola Jokić posted a remarkable triple-double with 23 points, 17 rebounds, and 14 assists against the Oklahoma City Thunder.

items.headline: Kon Knueppel Breaks Rookie 3-Point Record
items.summary: Charlotte Hornets rookie Kon Knueppel made history by hitting 8 three-pointers in his 28-point performance, surpassing the NBA rookie record for most three-pointers made in a season.

items.headline: Precious Achiuwa Sets Career High
items.summary: Sacramento Kings forward Precious Achiuwa notched a career-high 29 points and pulled down 12 rebounds in their win over the Dallas Mavericks.

items.headline: Brandon Miller Scores 33 for Hornets
items.summary: Charlotte Hornets forward Brandon Miller was the top scorer for his team with an impressive 33 points against the Indiana Pacers.

items.headline: Anthony Edwards Leads Wolves with 31 Points
items.summary: Anthony Edwards delivered a strong performance with 31 points to lead the Minnesota Timberwolves to victory over the LA Clippers.

items.headline: Eastern Conference Playoff Picture: Pistons Lead Tight Race
items.summary: As of February 27, 2026, the Detroit Pistons lead the Eastern Conference with a 43-14 record, followed by the Boston Celtics (38-20) and New York Knicks (37-22). The Cleveland Cavaliers are also strong contenders at 37-23.

items.headline: Western Conference Playoff Picture: Thunder Maintain Top Spot
items.summary: The Oklahoma City Thunder continue to lead the Western Conference with a 46-15 record. The San Antonio Spurs (41-16) and Houston Rockets (35-21) are hot on their heels, with the Denver Nuggets (37-23) also in the top tier.

items.headline: Celtics Continue Post-All-Star Break Surge
items.summary: The Boston Celtics are one of the league's hottest teams since the All-Star break, showcased by their historically efficient offensive performance against the Nets, where they achieved a season-high 66.7% field goal percentage.

items.headline: Mavericks GM Praises Rookie Cooper Flagg's Impact
items.summary: Mavericks co-interim GM Matt Riccardi lauded rookie Cooper Flagg, stating he has already exceeded expectations and is a 'two-way force' for Dallas, playing at a high level for a young player.
